website_summaries.verdict: Built for coffee purists who desire on-demand perfection.
pros: High marks for high-quality coffee that tastes like it's crafted, yet completely automated
Customers are quick to note the no-fuss functionality and consistency in the quality of taste
Engineered specifically for coffee and its nuances

customer_reviews.title: Makes Great Coffee Using Less Beans but Could be More Flexible
customer_reviews.text: Above all, this machine makes excellent coffee!! . . . . . Better than my Gaggia Academia which died in 4 years and better than my previous Jura which ran fine for about 20 years. We don't drink expresso, just coffee and I drink a large cup that takes two of the largest cups possible from the A1. I wish I could make one large cup from 2 initial button presses like the Gaggia. This machine also seems to use less coffee than previous machines which is a cost benefit. The water tank is too small and needs to be refilled after 2 or three cups.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: High Maintenance
customer_reviews.text: We recently purchased the Jura A1 because he had heard that the coffee was exceptional and the maintenance was low. However, we have had our machine for just over a week and it seems that there is always a light flashing that indicates some type of maintenance item -- the majority of which are refilling the water container & emptying the grinds. The coffee is not hot and the sizes do not allow for a full cup of coffee. The quality of the coffee is great however the continual maintenance of the machine does not justify the $800 purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Easy to use! Great Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my salon for customers and staff. It is simple to use. and saves me money by being able to use coffee beans or ground coffee instead of pods. I also love that this machine self cleans itself evey time it is turned on; and without using a TON of water. I also love that it has auto shut-off. So I dont have to worry that someone might leave it on overnight, or not clean it. I only wish it had a bigger water tank so I didnt have to refill as often. I highly recommend this, and will be getting one for home.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry H.

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee machine
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee machine. If you are a black coffee purist who enjoys ristretto, espressos or lungos, this Jura A1 delivers the fully automatic experience with quality and finesse.
customer_reviews.author: Tokyo reader

customer_reviews.title: No temp control, wastes too much water, needs constant refilling.
customer_reviews.text: Makes very good expresó but... it’s very expensive uses a ton of water, you have to constantly fill reservoir which is an awkward size and shape to handle. It seems that it wastes as much water as it uses to actually make the cup. Lots of water in the catch tray. Also, you can’t control the temperature. I sent it back. Maybe other models work better, or maybe mine had a leak? Don’t know, but thanks Amazon for taking it back!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Payne

customer_reviews.title: Great quality/convenient espresso, with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Jura A1 almost a month ago. I love the simple, high quality espresso it makes with relative ease. I wish the water reservoir were a bit larger, but refilling it every two days doesn’t bother me. My only complaint is the cleaning I have to do because of spilt coffee grounds inside the tray. Since the first day I used it, I noticed that it spills coffee grounds onto the tray insert (as opposed to all of the grounds dropping into the dredge basket). Not all the grounds spill, but enough do that I have to constantly scrub the tray to get the grounds off. This doesn’t seem to be normal behavior for a Jura.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Barton

customer_reviews.title: Pay the extra for one of the higher end models
customer_reviews.text: Don’t bother with this machine - pay the extra money for one of the other models. This machine replaced a Jura ENA 5 which we loved and lasted 10 years. This machine lasted precisely one year and one week!
customer_reviews.author: Mnbrit

customer_reviews.title: Once you go Jura...... you’ll forget about Starbucks!
customer_reviews.text: I’m obsessed with this super automatic! I pull 10-12 shots a day for myself and I get so much accomplished each day! Before I had this machine I would spend 10 minutes at a time in drive thrus and lobby’s of the local coffee spot. I just press power- walk away for a minute and when I walk back by it’s ready to brew. Ive even trained my children to bring me a couple shots each morning before I’m even out of bed!!!!! Plus I’m saving at least $4,000 a year on Starbucks!
customer_reviews.author: Caffeinated to the max

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Quiet, Stylish, Simple with a reasonably small footprint
customer_reviews.text: The Ristretto and espresso if phenomenal. A simple machine with no milk drinks (you can froth milk on your own and save a thousand). This machine is quick and quiet. Warm up time is virtually instantaneous. Grind and brew time is super fast. We had a Krups for a few years and the coffee was bland plus it had some design flaws that ultimately led to its demise. When I chose this machine I was looking for simple. Not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: QM

customer_reviews.title: The most delicious coffee!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this coffee maker as a result of having coffee made by my sisters Jura while on vacation. The coffee is so smooth and froth-like even though no milk was used. Truly brings out the best of the coffee bean! I also feel good about not using any non compostable material...no filters, no k cups, etc...the spent grounds can be tossed into the compost pile if that is what you choose to do. The only down side I would say is the water tank size, but I did order the Jura A1 which is the smallest, so I understand its limitations. Overall, an excellent cup of coffee every morning!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Wagner

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This machine makes the weakest coffee. And if you try to return it, they charge you a 15% restocking fee!!! That’s $100+ just to try the machine. Not worth it! Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Alexi Polydorides

customer_reviews.title: Great design, taste not so great.
customer_reviews.text: Liked the compact minimalist style, the low noise it made during grinding and brewing. However my partner and I found the taste of the espresso not as good as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Graafland

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Coffee Machine
customer_reviews.text: Love this Jura coffee machine! Very easy to use and it just works. I just wish they would offer the white version in the US and not only the black one.
customer_reviews.author: Mary & Kai

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is advertised to do
customer_reviews.text: I drink only one or two cups of coffee a day. No one else in my household is a coffee drinker. I purchased this machine because i was dissatisfied with the taste of pod machines and unhappy with the inconvenience and waste of drip coffee makers. This machine strikes the perfect balance for me - i get good tasking coffee from freshly ground beans, and i get it one cup at a time. Works as advertised out of the box. Had it for several weeks now and it works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Cozz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i love this coffeemaker. it lives up to its reputation.
customer_reviews.author: mdrhea

customer_reviews.title: Spoil rotten with this thing
customer_reviews.text: If you can afford it, do it! Best thing you can do if you need or want convinces! This is easy for us to put beans and water in and just push a button. Don’t have to think about ratios or grinding our beans! So this is a lust/luxury purchase and would recommend it over and over again. I have gone through a few different types of coffee machines and seriously don’t need to consider anything else! This is the one haha
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, slight hassle.
customer_reviews.text: It’s awesome !! Coffee great !! So compact. But really annoying to have to clean all the time, fill with water (small tank) and other maintenance. If you can deal with small hassle so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Znt

customer_reviews.title: Can’t live without it now!
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! I can’t say that enough. So worth the money. I can’t even drink coffee from local shops. Doesn’t compare. And I live in Seattle!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew McFaddin

customer_reviews.title: I’m Human Again
customer_reviews.text: OMG! Lifesaver as I stumble into the kitchen every morning, hit one button and wonderful, aromatic elixir of the gods comes out. I’m human again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Forget starbucks, this thing makes better coffee or just as good I guess. Huge money saver if you buy Starbucks everyday. You can even still buy Starbucks beans if you want.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Chase

customer_reviews.title: Update: Still yet to receive REFUND!!!! Machine arrived broken after long wait
customer_reviews.text: I sent the product back to you but it's not marked as received nor received the refund. I received the product today, and the grinder is dead. Not working. Verified by GCS Vancouver Jura. I will not pay for the shipping fee to return the product. Refund the money today please
customer_reviews.author: charles y.

customer_reviews.title: This had been an open box item and not sure what the previous person possibly did to the product?
customer_reviews.text: I received this as open box item... when I added water and then went to operate the water leaked out the bottom. I’m returning and ordering another. I still believe this is a very good product. My son in law has a different model but works fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Aspen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The best coffee ever. As my daughter says, “this is the closest thing to heroin she has ever had”. That is a joke....sort of. We have had it for over a year and use LaVazza super crema. Yes, the footprint is weird. Yes, you have to fill up the water reservoir a lot. But it makes awesome coffee. Maintenance is tolerable for such good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Cannon

customer_reviews.title: great coffee and easy to use machine
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Jura coffee maker. We got the smaller, simpler machine this time and it is perfect. So easy to use and the coffee is just right. Our previous machine lasted about 8 years. I was not careful about cleaning its and using the right beans. I will this time. We did not use any of the extra features like milk frothing so we got this model this time and I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley barganier

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: This coffee machine was purchased to replace our previous Jura that lasted almost 10 years with heavy office use. We have had this one for a few months and it already stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: WinstonMaverick

customer_reviews.title: Jura Coffee Flavor
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful looking Jura A1, really compliments the kitchen. My last (Jura ENA3) lasted an amazing 10 yrs, and I didn't always follow the clean notification. The coffee flavor, and creme, are both 5 star. Update: Im told that this is the best tasting Jura they've had at my home. I owned the ENA 3 previously for a decade.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to complain
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to complain, considering buying another one for decaf. Buyers note: it is swiss made
customer_reviews.author: alexlo

customer_reviews.title: Great machine easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his espresso from this machine. We needed a smaller machine for our 2nd home and this works great. We froth our milk separately and I can offer our guests excellent cappuccino.
customer_reviews.author: Pick

customer_reviews.title: Makes good coffee
customer_reviews.text: Makes great coffee! Only flaw is you might have to nuke your cup in the microwave for 15 seconds if you add cream!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Quinlan

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee machine!!! Easy to use, not too loud, tastes delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: cumbersome, ok coffee
customer_reviews.text: the operation is cumbersome, ok to so so coffee. Stopped working after 2.5 years - not able to fill the machine with water.
customer_reviews.author: Jerzy Grzebieluch

customer_reviews.title: coffee tastes like water
customer_reviews.text: coffee tastes very diluted and tasteless. It does not brew coffee well or long enough!
customer_reviews.author: pawan rastogi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine! Replace my 11 year old JURA ENA 4. Much better product!
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to clean, clogs up, stops working intermittently.
customer_reviews.text: The machine makes a fantastic cup of coffee/espresso. But it clogs easily and often stops working if not cleaned properly, which is hard to do.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy way to make your coffee
customer_reviews.text: Works with no fuss and no mess. You press a button and out comes good coffee. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jovan

customer_reviews.title: Great home machine
customer_reviews.text: Makes a great Expresso. Wish that the water tank was easier to view.
customer_reviews.author: John N

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality and simplicity!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! This coffee maker is amazing. Much better coffee than either of my Nespresso machines and no more pods to buy!!!! Love the simplicity and quality of this Jura coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Tobi Martin

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! So pleased. Just what I expected and more.
customer_reviews.author: Catie Jackson

customer_reviews.title: So far excellent. Best espresso I've had
customer_reviews.text: So far excellent. Best espresso I've had. Intelligent cleaning system.
customer_reviews.author: TBR

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Machine arrived on time. Unfortunately, it didn't work. The water won't go into.the system. We called Jura and they weren't able to help. We haven't been able to get 1 cup of coffee out of the machine.
customer_reviews.author: happy camper

customer_reviews.title: Coffee lovers
customer_reviews.text: We love our new coffee maker does everything I expected. Puts out great coffee would not change a thing. We have at least two cups of coffee each a day with no problem ,maintains itself , very easy to use.. can't believe we had a Nespresso as long as we did
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: The one I have been waiting for
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through my fair share of machines over the years and until recently had succumbed to the simplicity of Nespresso. If you are looking for a no frills espresso / coffee automatic that makes and excellent cup of coffee, you will be very pleased with this machine. I wish the water tank was a little larger but it is sufficient to make about 3 x 8 ounce cups before needing refill.
customer_reviews.author: Loustar

customer_reviews.title: If you are an espresso lover/snob, this machine is not for you
customer_reviews.text: Coffee is weak and not quite hot enough. I’ve tried several different beans, no difference. I read all the reviews that it makes the best espresso but it’s just not true. If you are really an espresso snob, you will not like the coffee that comes out of this machine. I’ve had great espresso machines all my life and this just does not make good coffee. Not much crema, and it’s weak/watered down. I kept it for 2 weeks drinking several espressos a day hoping it would get better, adjusted the grind, tried several different highly rated espresso beans and they all come out the same. Not a good espresso. Save yourself the disappointment and buy a different machine.
customer_reviews.author: Niq

customer_reviews.title: Designed to wear out. It only lasted  about 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Mine lasted about a year before the coffee started tasting weak and the grounds were more a slurry than a puck even at the finest grind setting. A Google search says this means the grinder burrs have worn down and need to be replaced. Unfortunately, the burrs are not available as replacement parts. The only option is to replace the entire grinder assembly. I was quoted $450 for the repair. I thought I was buying a robust unit that would last for many years based on the brand reputation. Unfortunately, it seems it’s a cheap disposable unit due to the lack of replaceable burrs. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Technik

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee but 2 drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Like all Juras, this produces amazing coffee and espresso. Also, it is more efficient with beans than our Impressa. Two negatives - the small water tank which is located on the back. It needs to be filled multiple times any given morning and because we have the machine on the countertop, under the cabinet and the tank is on the back, filling is difficult. Second negative is that 8oz. (And that is a stretch) is the max for a cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent crema, excellent taste
customer_reviews.text: Lives up to its promise. Had my Jura A1 since August of 2017 and make 2-3 cups espresso daily. Excellent crema, excellent taste, easy to brew. Easy to clean (I use off-brand cleaning tabs rather than the expensive Jura tabs and they work fine). Make sure you keep the instruction manual handy though; there are 11 symbols that light up to signal various things and they are not always obvious what they are telling you.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B. Greenspan

customer_reviews.title: Easy coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I love this wonderful machine! We bought this to replace an old Delonghi machine that served us well but was out of warranty. This espresso machine fits all the checkmarks. It is a fast start-up and fast brew. The number one feature is the taste. A wonderful cup of espresso every time. It is also easy to maintain with the cleaning pellets and the filter for the water. My only small negative is the smallish water tank but that is minor. Also, love how you can have three different sizes and then be able to precisely determine how much coffee is dispensed for each. Overall this machine is perfect if you like quick tasty espresso in the morning!
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Simple, functional, elegant and excellent and quality
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is the best value for money that you can get. Sure, it only does coffee but if you are a real coffee drinker then that is more than enough. It can grind the beans into different grades and produce espresso dopio or coffee and you can enjoy it. It's easy to maintain, easy to use and in addition to the wonderful coffee it reduces, it looks excellent in your office, kitchen, countertop or any other place where you wish to decorate it with elegance.
customer_reviews.author: Santosh Krishnan

customer_reviews.title: This makes good coffee
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned the Jura Z7 which is over 3 more times the cost of the A1 so I was spoiled. The A1makes good coffee for one or two people. It would be far too time consuming for a group as you would constantly have to fill the water and empty the grounds and clean it. I still give it a 4 star as it makes good coffee and grinds the beans so it is fresh.
customer_reviews.author: CFT

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Some may find this a little expensive, but the coffee is well worth it. It is consistently rich and delicious. Maintenance so far has been worry free. It is easy to set up, easy to clean and takes up very little counter space. The cup size is rather small at first but you can adjust pour size easily...or just brew two cups. I use Stumptown beans and each cup is as delicious as the last. We have a larger Jura machine that has been cranking out cups for the last three or four years - sometimes up to 8-10 cups per day. The math works out for me, especially given the taste of the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Go with the white color one.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I remember. Getting great mileage out of this awesome machine. Looking great, smelling great, tasting great
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Y

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: I have this machine at home and bought one on here for my office. It arrived broken. I contacted Jura for assistance and they helped me with trouble shooting that the water line was broken. I sent it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: L. King

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee ever
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this machine for 2 days but it makes fantastic coffee. This replaces the Gaggia Brera I had that broke after 3 years. It heats up and grinds very fast. The PIP expresso is probably the best I have ever had. I roast my own beans and this is a great addition to my coffee passion.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing coffee, no more plastic waste
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker. So simple and makes amazing coffee. The upfront cost is high, but after that it's just the cost of the coffee you use by the pound, no need to buy coffee pods or k-cups anymore, which saves money and the environment. One of our favorite purchases ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer AKW

customer_reviews.title: dead in 21 months
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality of drink. Used 7-8 times a day during 21 months after that began to grind coffee just into trunk. Too expensive for this working cycle.
customer_reviews.author: EprstEklmn

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Jura we own. It is quite compact and makes excellent coffee. The coffee at maximum strength is not as strong as our other Jura can make (which is a Z8), but it is quite a bit larger and more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: DrBiff

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Excellent coffee - exceeded expectations. Was looking for a coffee maker that can give us coffee on-demand. Thought of Keurig, but passed. Tried a new Nespresso and the coffee was very good but hated the thought of buying so many pods - and storing them. This meets our needs for a larger cup of coffee that’s fresh anytime and tastes great as well as the bonus of espressos. Use La Colombe Corsica beans. Don’t hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2 people who only drink black short or ...
customer_reviews.text: It took us a few tries to be completly confortable with this machine but the end result is superb. It uses less water and less coffee grains as our previous italian machine. Perfect for 2 people who only drink black short or long expresso.
customer_reviews.author: SOPHIE B.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Coffee and Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: Had the machine for over three weeks and still love it. Easy to use and fits my need for a fine espresso or coffee without a lot of gadgets and fuss. It tells you what to do and when to do it! So much better than using prepackaged "cups." The taste is fresh and there is no waste. Every time I use it, I'm amazed by the precision and quality.
customer_reviews.author: JayMan

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Shop Performance At Home!
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker so far. I haven’t rated it for durability because I’ve only had it for a few weeks, and therefore couldn’t give an honest rating. My only complaint so far is a minor one—I wish it made my coffee a little hotter. It’s hot enough but cools fast if you don’t drink it fairly quickly. It looks good in my kitchen and gets many compliments.
customer_reviews.author: Louis B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Home-Brewed Coffee Ever
customer_reviews.text: Love the crema of the coffee brewed. Easy to use and maintain. Low cost to operate. Beats the multiple Keurigs I have purchased over the years. Once you try this, there is no going back to other coffee makers
customer_reviews.author: LOLmom

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after fourteen months.
customer_reviews.text: ..and for six months it is impossible to contact anyone at Jura to service the broken machine. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F

customer_reviews.title: Makes really nice espresso.
customer_reviews.text: Makes really nice espresso right from the start. A little larger footprint than expected. For capuchinos and lattes I use an Aerolatte milk frother. That will save a lot of $$$ and cleaning effort.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: The best coffee you can get anywhere
customer_reviews.text: The best coffee you can get anywhere. Much quieter and faster than my parents 10yo Jura but I had to send it back because of an issue reprogramming the cup size. I will be reordering after I get over it. Did I mention this makes coffee on par with the best on the planet?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Jura A1 Super Automatic Coffee Machine, 1, Piano Black
product_meta.description: Color:Piano BlackWake up with a hot cup of espresso made with the Jura A1 Espresso Machine. This beautiful, quality coffee, espresso, and ristretto maker comes in a Piano Black color and is designed with sleek clean lines. The top side has a visible bean container and an intuitive symbol control panel to make your morning shot of espresso simple to make. You'll get a consistently delicious drink with the thermoblock heating system with 15 bar pump, and you can choose between two levels of coffee strength. This machine comes with an Aroma grinder and CLEARYL Blue filter for the high quality cup of coffee that you expect from Jura. An auto shut off program is included in the machine for your safety. Whether you crave a shot of ristretto or a cup of coffee, the coffee spout adjusts to your needs from 2. 3 to 5. 5 inches. For your convenience, the A1 has a self cleaning option that will remind you after 180 preparations or 80 switch-on rinses when it needs to run so you don't have to worry. 17-1/2" L x 9-1/2" W x 12-3/4" H, with a 37 ounce water capacity; 4. 4 ounce bean container; 9 serving ground container
feature_bullets: ONE TOUCH: Prepare 3 barista quality specialties including ristretto, espresso and coffee at the touch of a button - coffee only
PERFECT ESPRESSO: Ultimate coffee quality thanks to JURA's exclusive Pulse Extraction Process
CONICAL BURR GRINDER: Fast and precise AromaG3 grinder grinds whole beans to the optimum fineness
: JURA is always freshly ground, not capsuled - fresh taste with very limited waste - single serve machine
CAPACITY: 37 ounce water tank, 4. 4 ounce bean container

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars140 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
